SEARCH
Package ascii_art

Class Git

java.lang.Object
ascii_art.Git
public class Git extends Object
A class that is used as a save to gain runtime and avoid unnecessary operations. It's based on the principe of momentum that we learned in class. We choose this name because its funny, and it explains quit well how it is supposed to work
Version:
Java 11
Author:
Noam Shabat and Samuel Hayat

  • Method Details

    • saveCharacterBrightness

      public void saveCharacterBrightness(char character, double brightness)
      This function is in charge to save a character and his brightness to the database
      Parameters:
      character - The character we want to save
      brightness - The brightness value of the character

    • restoreCharBrightness

      public double restoreCharBrightness(char character)
      This function returns the brightness value of a character if it is stored in the database We assume that you have already checked if the character is in the database or not
      Parameters:
      character - The character we want to get the brighness value of
      Returns:
      The Brightness value of the character

    • containsChar

      public boolean containsChar(char character)
      Check if a specified char is in the database
      Parameters:
      character - The specified character
      Returns:
      True if he is, otherwise False

    • saveImageData

      public void saveImageData(String fileName, char[][] output)
      This function is in charge to save an asciiImage to the database with the name of the file as a key
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file
      output - The Image we want to save

    • restoreImage

      public char[][] restoreImage(String saveName)
      Retrieves an ascii image from the database. This function assumes that you checked if the designed image is already in the database
      Parameters:
      saveName - The name of the image
      Returns:
      the image associated with the given name

    • containsImage

      public boolean containsImage(String fileName)
      This function checks if the image associated with a name is in the database
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the image
      Returns:
      True if the image is in the database, false otherwise
